channel.title: Java Text - Based Game - The Punished
channel.description:
I decided to make a text - based game a little while ago. The idea is that there is a shop and a mine. You need a pick when in the mine so you buy one in the shop. Then you can sell the ores back to the shop and make money. There isn't much of a goal yet. It finally supports saving and loading from a text file. Here are the videos of my development:
The dates are formatted as: MM/DD/YEAR
[url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZpzHUzj4GVw][Time lapse] Creating a Java Game - Ore Probability:[/url] 1/19/11 [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tTpy7QfXwOA][Time Lapse] Creating a Java Game - Adding a Shop (No Functionality)[/url] 1/20/11 [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MPl7f6IBXSU][Time Lapse] Creating a Java Game - Adding Some Functionality to the Shop[/url] 1/21/11 [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iu-XITSQwQo][Time Lapse] Creating a Java Game - Buying and Using Items[/url] 1/23/11 [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Pjk1NE1i6wc][Time Lapse] Creating a Java Game - Fixing Items and Saving/Loading[/url] 1/24/11 [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k0x964A7QGM][Time Lapse] Creating a Java Game - Fixing up the Shop and Adding Pickaxe Durability[/url] 2/9/11 [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=U48f0wqXpqA]Creating a Java Game - Documentation and Changes Part 1[/url] 2/15/11 [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HtgEkFkFb6E]Creating a Java Game - Documentation and Changes Part 2[/url] 2/15/11 [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=slSWY9JKYWo]Creating a Java Game - Wiki, Download, and Fixing Mining a Bit[/url]2/16/11 [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6YUCE4Ddtbg]Creating a Java Game - Contract System - ALMOST DONE[/url] 2/23/11 [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sEHOzReSy3E]Creating a Java Game - Gameplay V 1.2_02[/url] 2/28/11 [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VQLXlVyablw]Creating a Java Game - Leveling System[/url] 3/26/11 [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QlTx69kwx1Y]Creating a Java Game - Beginings of the Combat System[/url] 4/2/11 [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VA4Gr62OWOk]Creating a Java Game - Update Video[/url] 5/5/11 [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sthRkWU4cbg]Creating a Java Game - MASSIVE UPDATE[/url] 6/23/11 [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DP3Fy-t15k4][Timelapse] Creating a Java Game - Adding the Dark Forrest[/url] 6/25/11 [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DP3Fy-t15k4]Creating a Java Game - Fixing and Adding Functionality 100th Video![/url] 7/1/11 [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s79pom4A81E]Creating a Java Game - OPEN SOURCE?!?!?[/url] 7/24/11
[b]*NEW*[/b]
[url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AZB6Xo5ZqTM]The Punished - REMAKE 01 Working on the Shop[/url] 9/24/11
[b]EXAMPLE GAME INTERACTION:[/b] This is old I used code so that it scrolls [code]Welcome to the game!
------------------------- | mine - Go to the mine | | shop - Go to the shop | | save - Save your game | | load - Load your game | -------------------------
Enter your choice: load
Your inventory is: [P, BP, DP, Stone, Coal, Iron, Diamond, Gold]
Welcome to the game!
------------------------- | mine - Go to the mine | | shop - Go to the shop | | save - Save your game | | load - Load your game | -------------------------
Enter your choice: shop Would you like to buy or sell something? sell
These are the Items you have: [P, BP, DP, Stone, Coal, Iron, Diamond, Gold]
The shop will buy ores you mine: ----------------------------- | Ore: Price: | |---------------------------| | Stone - 10 gold coins | | Coal - 50 gold coins | | Iron - 75 gold coins | | Gold - 300 gold coins | | Diamond - 500 gold coins | ----------------------------- Which Item would you like to sell? Stone
That item sells for 10 gold coins. You now have: 1010 gold coins. Your inventory is now: [P, BP, DP, Coal, Iron, Diamond, Gold] Welcome to the game!
------------------------- | mine - Go to the mine | | shop - Go to the shop | | save - Save your game | | load - Load your game | -------------------------
Enter your choice: shop Would you like to buy or sell something? sell
These are the Items you have: [P, BP, DP, Coal, Iron, Diamond, Gold]
The shop will buy ores you mine: ----------------------------- | Ore: Price: | |---------------------------| | Stone - 10 gold coins | | Coal - 50 gold coins | | Iron - 75 gold coins | | Gold - 300 gold coins | | Diamond - 500 gold coins | ----------------------------- Which Item would you like to sell? Coal
That item sells for 50 gold coins. You now have: 1060 gold coins. Your inventory is now: [P, BP, DP, Iron, Diamond, Gold] Welcome to the game!
------------------------- | mine - Go to the mine | | shop - Go to the shop | | save - Save your game | | load - Load your game | -------------------------
Enter your choice: shop Would you like to buy or sell something? sell
These are the Items you have: [P, BP, DP, Iron, Diamond, Gold]
The shop will buy ores you mine: ----------------------------- | Ore: Price: | |---------------------------| | Stone - 10 gold coins | | Coal - 50 gold coins | | Iron - 75 gold coins | | Gold - 300 gold coins | | Diamond - 500 gold coins | ----------------------------- Which Item would you like to sell? Iron
That item sells for 75 gold coins. You now have: 1135 gold coins. Your inventory is now: [P, BP, DP, Diamond, Gold] Welcome to the game!
------------------------- | mine - Go to the mine | | shop - Go to the shop | | save - Save your game | | load - Load your game | -------------------------
Enter your choice: shop Would you like to buy or sell something? sell
These are the Items you have: [P, BP, DP, Diamond, Gold]
The shop will buy ores you mine: ----------------------------- | Ore: Price: | |---------------------------| | Stone - 10 gold coins | | Coal - 50 gold coins | | Iron - 75 gold coins | | Gold - 300 gold coins | | Diamond - 500 gold coins | ----------------------------- Which Item would you like to sell? Gold
That item sells for 300 gold coins. You now have: 1435 gold coins. Your inventory is now: [P, BP, DP, Diamond] Welcome to the game!
------------------------- | mine - Go to the mine | | shop - Go to the shop | | save - Save your game | | load - Load your game | -------------------------
Enter your choice: shop Would you like to buy or sell something? sell
These are the Items you have: [P, BP, DP, Diamond]
The shop will buy ores you mine: ----------------------------- | Ore: Price: | |---------------------------| | Stone - 10 gold coins | | Coal - 50 gold coins | | Iron - 75 gold coins | | Gold - 300 gold coins | | Diamond - 500 gold coins | ----------------------------- Which Item would you like to sell? Diamond
That item sells for 500 gold coins. You now have: 1935 gold coins. Your inventory is now: [P, BP, DP] Welcome to the game!
------------------------- | mine - Go to the mine | | shop - Go to the shop | | save - Save your game | | load - Load your game | -------------------------
Enter your choice: save Welcome to the game!
------------------------- | mine - Go to the mine | | shop - Go to the shop | | save - Save your game | | load - Load your game | -------------------------
Enter your choice:
Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
Tell me what you think! If you want to test the game out here is a link!
All of the versions of the game are available from the website: [url=http://thepunished.herobo.com/Media.htm]http://thepunished.herobo.com/Media.htm[/url] The source code is available at : [url=http://thepunished.herobo.com/Open%20Source.htm]http://thepunished.herobo.com/Open%20Source.htm[/url]
[b]Wiki:[/b] [url=http://tehrealbinglebob.wikidot.com/]http://tehrealbinglebob.wikidot.com/[/url] Use the drop down menu: Text - Based Game [b]--Isn't updated anymore[/b]

Thanks! I did give up on this a little bit, but I did release the first version of the remake which can be found here: http://thepunished.herobo.com/media.html

I’ve been busy doing some 2D stuff, maybe I will get back to this soon.

[/quote]

?? Then what’s with that message in wikidiot or somewhere saying you stooped hmthe develoomens of it because the project is getting boring for you. And that is the latest update…[/quote]

I haven’t updated the website or the wiki in ages. The Punished REMAKE videos are going on now on YouTube. I just can’t work on the game until christmas break because I got waaaay too much shit to do for school right now.

item.title: Java Text - Based Game - The Punished
item.dc:creator: @sp11k3t3ht3rd sp11k3t3ht3rd
item.description:
@sp11k3t3ht3rd wrote:

[quote=“sppt, post:165, topic:381930”]I haven’t really followed your progress, but I looked through your vid a bit, and I’ve got a tip for you:
Try initializing ArrayLists with a size if you know how big it’s gonna be.
It’s much more efficient in the long run, especially if it’s going to be a really big ArrayList.[/quote]

I won’t know how big it will be unless I figure out all the indexes and then create the arraylist after I find the indexes. The way I have it now, it will populate the arraylist for ever index of the item name you supply, but I could call that method before and get the number of indexes and then do it. Idk though because it has to do that every time you complete a contract so does it really make a difference?

Read full topic
item.source: Java Text - Based Game - The Punished

item.title: Java Text - Based Game - The Punished
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“ranger squad, post:162, topic:381930”][quote author=ytuio9` link=topic=477738.msg3495957#msg3495957 date=1297308820]
I’m sure it can be shortened even more by people more experienced than I…
[/quote]

[code=java]public class Miner {
private int randomOre;
private String ores[] = { “Stone”, “Coal”, “Iron”, “Gold”, “Diamond”};

public static void main (String[] args) {
	randomOre = (int) (Math.random() * 100);
	System.out.println("ore:" + getOre(randomOre));
}

public String getOre(int chance) {
	if (chance <= 50) return ores[0];
	else if (chance >= 51 && chance <= 71) return ores[1];
	else if (chance >= 72 && chance <= 92) return ores[2];
	else if (chance >= 93 && chance <= 99) return ores[3];
	else return ores[5];
}

}[/code]

Should work, untested.[/quote]

This has a logic flaw. [tt]Math.random()[/tt] has a range of [0,1), so the [tt]randomOre[/tt] variable will never be 100. A better approach would be [tt]randomOre = (int) (Math.random() * 101);[/tt]

Read full topic
item.source: Java Text - Based Game - The Punished

item.title: Java Text - Based Game - The Punished
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

I haven’t really followed your progress, but I looked through your vid a bit, and I’ve got a tip for you:
Try initializing ArrayLists with a size if you know how big it’s gonna be.
It’s much more efficient in the long run, especially if it’s going to be a really big ArrayList.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @ranger_squad ranger squad
item.description:
@ranger_squad wrote:

ytuio9`:

I’m sure it can be shortened even more by people more experienced than I…

[code=java]public class Miner {
private int randomOre;
private String ores[] = { “Stone”, “Coal”, “Iron”, “Gold”, “Diamond”};

public static void main (String[] args) {
	randomOre = (int) (Math.random() * 100);
	System.out.println("ore:" + getOre(randomOre));
}

public String getOre(int chance) {
	if (chance <= 50) return ores[0];
	else if (chance >= 51 && chance <= 71) return ores[1];
	else if (chance >= 72 && chance <= 92) return ores[2];
	else if (chance >= 93 && chance <= 99) return ores[3];
	else return ores[5];
}

}[/code]

Should work, untested.

item.title: Java Text - Based Game - The Punished
item.dc:creator: @sp11k3t3ht3rd sp11k3t3ht3rd
item.description:
@sp11k3t3ht3rd wrote:

[quote=“Cres, post:148, topic:381930”][quote author=sp11k3t3ht3rd link=topic=477738.msg3624546#msg3624546 date=1307731147]
But what would the wood be used for? I’m all for adding new items but I can’t seem to find a use for it.
[/quote]

add a new option called crafting , from here lt the player create new items , wood should be a crafting ingredient in most items :p[/quote]

I’ll think about it. I’ve got 2 finals tomorrow and 1 on Monday so I won’t be programming for a while.

EDIT: I’ve changed the leveling system to include attack, defense, and magic so you can level yourself in the dungeon. The crafting it partially implemented, You can make a sword if you have a piece of wood and a piece of stone (although there is no way to get wood yet). I’m thinking having a sword in your inventory will give a bonus temporarily to your attack level or something like that. I should probably add more monsters and make them less difficult too…

Read full topic
